content: vivaldi winter mitts winter is the fourth pair of mitts in the four seasons collection this is winter stillness and quiet the scent of wood smoke curling from chimneys and silent gently falling snow lace encircles the wrist and back of the hand with stockinette on the palm it is rhythmic intuitive and easy to memorize the pattern is written for magic loop but can easily be adapted for dpns please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 to determine your size wrap a flexible measuring tape around your hand below the knuckles excluding your thumb sizes tiny 7 0 smallish 7 5 larger 8 0 materials tiny fingering yarn 150 200 yards us 2 2 75mm circular needle 32 inches smallish sport/dk yarn 150 200 yards us 4 3 5mm circular needle 32 inches larger worsted yarn 150 200 yards us 6 4 0mm circular needle 32 inches notions 1 locking stitch marker 1 additional marker waste yarn and tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations cdd - s2kp slip 2 together knitwise knit 1 pass slipped stitches over knit stitch co - cast on using the backward loop method k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop k2tog - knit 2 together p - purl pm - place marker ssk - slip 1 knitwise slip 1 knitwise knit slipped stitches together through the back loop sm - slip marker st s - stitch es yo - yarn over this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 right mitt twisted rib cuff cast on 48 sts using a stretchy cast on method and divide evenly onto needle 1 and needle 2 being careful not to twist prepare to join and work in the round place a unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round k1tbl p1 for 10 rounds right wrist work rows1 24 of lace chart lace encircles the entire wrist so row 1 - 24 are each worked twice once per needle 1 & needle 2 right hand/thumb from this point forward the back of the hand needle 1 is worked from lace chart row 25 - 48 the palm needle 2 is worked in stockinette with thumb shaping needle 1 needle 2 round 25 work chart row 25 kfb kfb pm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 26 work chart row 26 k4 sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 27 work chart row 27 k4 sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 28 work chart row 28 k4 sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 29 work chart row 29 kfb k2 kfb sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 30 work chart row 30 k6 sm k1tbl
